name: Bon Aire Resort Motel

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights end of August beginning of Sept. Arrived at lunch time and although it said 4pm check in we were allowed straight into our room. The rooms are clean and spacious. Grounds of hotel are clean and the beach bar serves great food. Staff are pleasant. The hotel is right on the beach and our room had a great view of the beach. Pools are very nice, warm and clean. The beach is lovely soft sand and warm water. The hotel is at the best end of the beach i took a walk along to the other end and it was'nt as nice. Supermarket and restaurants nearby. Would definately stay again if in that area.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bon Aire on 8/8/09. The room was very clean and comfortable. Fantastic location on the beach. It has a great little beach bar, bartenders were very friendly, and the ribeye steak sandwich was awesome. I will definitely be back. Thanks Bon Aire!!!
reviews.title: Bon Aire Awesome

reviews.text: Bubba
reviews.title: Totally Awesome week--Couldn't Have Been Better!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 9th trip to St. Pete Beach and Bon-Aire. Our grandson went with us--his first trip to Florida. Hotel was excellent as usual. They actually had new bedspreads, and dish soap for the kitchen this year! The cleaning staff is AWSOME! The weather was GREAT! 90 or higher everyday. We had 3 days with about an hour of rain/storms--but it was always around lunch time so it worked out ok. Went to Fort Desoto Beach one day--stingrays--but still beautiful! Saw a couple of small sharks @ Bon-Aire Beach. Also a dead sea turtle that had washed up--pretty disgusting! I only have 3 complaints about Bon-Aire--1 * The ladies that work in the office need to improve their attitudes, they can be hateful. 2 * Parking--supposed to be for guests only--one night I saw about 8 cars without guest tag--no wonder you are only allowed 1 car per room! and 3 * Don't even bother trying to use the hotel's computer--every time you ask to use it the ladies in the office tell you that someone is using it(even if they aren't) I DON'T THINK THEY WANT TO GET UP AND UNLOCK THE DOOR. Just wait until you get to the airport to print your boarding passes--much better than dealing with attitudes!!!!!!
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.text: Returned home from The Bon Aire yesterday and I already wish I was back there. The Bon Aire is a great motel the staff are very helpful and the grounds are beautiful and well kept the rooms are clean and have nice flat screen TV. We had the water front room on the ground floor room 123., what a view we had from the large window facing the gulf. There are many typs of room to fit everybody,s needs.The staff and other guest there are all very nice and friendly.and helpful they are two pools which are also very clean .I can go on and on about this resort but you really have to be there to get the full effect I hope to return there next year for an evev longer stay
reviews.title: The Bon-Aire is all you need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best bargain on the beach. This is a wonderful, 1950's era place that has the same feel as renting a little house on the beach - the rooms and fixtures are well-loved, the nice lady at the counter will give you some coffee filters if you ask, it's just like being at your favorite aunt's house. Location is spectacular, easy to find, right off highway. Rooms with kitchenettes are great for meals when you don't want to eat out. And Sandbar Bill's Bar and Grill, right out back on the beach, had fantastic service and the best burgers anywhere. If I ever need to be in St. Pete again, I will be staying at the Bon Aire.
reviews.title: Cheeseburgers in Paradise

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights from 26th October. After reading some bad reviews I was a bit nervous about the place. Who ever wrote a bad review about the Bon Aire should stay at the Don CeSar next time. However I dont think the rates would be as good. The Motel is perfect with the trolly stop right outside, Walgreens across the street and a magnificent beach on your doorstep. Our room was very clean and tidy, with a sink, cooker, microwave and fridge. There was a choice of two pools and plenty of seats and sunbeds for everyone. The staff were fabulous too. I have never stayed here before but I will certainly stay here again. I would reccomend the Bon Aire to everyone.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fine 3 night stay in early November at the Bon Aire. I chose this property from the TA list of lodgings. Very clean and furnishings comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Other guests too. The beach was steps away and the view from the hotel patio was amazing. We enjoyed the lounge chairs on the brick patio for hours at a time. Lots of locals there for a weekend stay and family parties. Tourists from other properties were there too, for the cheeseburgers and drinks from beach bar.
reviews.title: Happy to find the Bon Aire

reviews.text: Will go again and try to get the rest of our family there too!
reviews.title: Bon Aire Forever!!!

likes.disliked: — parking not enough ocean view rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been bringing my family to the BonAire for 20 years. My children grew up playing on the beach and now my second husband and I stay here. He loves it too. You can't beat the price(still) and the location is perfect!! You have to book early, I usually go in June and book the October before. It is so homey and comfortable,clean and newly updated with the "old Florida flair.
reviews.title: Bon-Aire Motel

likes.liked: — Beautiful landscaping and location on the beach
likes.disliked: — Not many restaurants within walking distance

reviews.text: Just returned from our first stay at the Bon-Aire. As described in other reviews, it is an old motel and comes with some ups and downs. On the upside:
reviews.title: Awesome time at the Bon Aire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the location on the beach is unbeatable, you're never more than 40 steps away from the beautiful white sands of St. Pete Beach.
reviews.title: Delighted First Timers

reviews.text: - The value is excellent.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home...

likes.disliked: — bed could use mattress pads and fitted sheets

reviews.text: My wife's family has stayed at the Bon Aire for decades and this was my third time staying there. We stayed five nights in July. I love the Bon Aire, it has a great location on the beach and is clean and really afffordable (about $100 per night).
reviews.title: Back to the Bon Aire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 108, about 50 feet from the sand and it looks like they have done some upgrades since our last stay in 2006. Granite counters in the kitchenette and a new plasma tv.
reviews.title: worth every penny

likes.liked: — the view and how clean our room was

reviews.title: Decent Lodging, Great Value
reviews.text: There are two pools and shuffleboard courts in addition to one of the best beaches I've ever been on. Sandbar Bill's is there little beach bar, which is nice to have.
This is not a brand new property, it was built in the 1950s and it looks like it, but it is very clean and grounds are maintained very well. Parking is a little cramped, not many spots available.
reviews.title: mold, rudeness, lumpy beds..oh my!

reviews.text: I'll definitely keep coming back.
reviews.title: Don't listen to the bad reviews!!!!

reviews.text: I was not surprised to find this resort as it had been described- very nice! I enjoyed my stay there and will probably stay there again. The location is excellent as it is right on the beach. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and met my needs perfectly. I would have liked wireless internet in my room, but I was told that is forthcoming. Also, an outdoor jacuzzi would be nice.
reviews.title: The resort was just the way it was described by previous travelers.

reviews.text: I stayed here with a large group of my family. The hotel is not the most up to date place, however it makes up for it in location and feel. The location is the best in St. Pete's. The beach is wide and not crowded and you are centerally located to lots of good food. With the beach bar right there it's nice not to have to leave in the evening for drinks. I had a great time and will go back.
reviews.title: Great Family Feel

reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Bon Aire motel. It was a relaxing family vacation.
reviews.title: Great time-great little motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE PROS (there are many)
reviews.title: Great location, but guests are nickel & dimed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -the location is ON THE BEACH
reviews.title: Not as good as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the Bon Aire and have recommended to family and friends. most of the people that stay there are long time visitors.
reviews.title: Lovely reasonable older motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pat- Chicago, IL
reviews.title: Watch The prices at the beach bar!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Rip off food and beverage SCAM

reviews.text: OK, Lets talk about the beach bar. The hamburgers and food are really good. Yet there is a drawback. They BEACH BAR STAFF have two menu's. One for "tourist visiting" and one for the "Locals". The prices can vary from $5.50 for a hamburger to $7.50. and .75 cent difference for a daft beer. BEWARE! PAY AS YOU GO AND ASK PRICES BEFORE YOU ORDER! We where shocked at the second visit. After the bill was presented we where given the explanation that a " old menu " had somehow resurfaced and was incorrected. That we where bounded by "law" to the "actual" prices. OK, the third time the same exzact thing happened. We paid the bill and reporeted them to the STATE. Good food but BEWARE! they will try to rip you every chance they get. - golow00
reviews.title: A great family place

likes.liked: — it was comfortable and definately affordable!!
likes.disliked: — we had to leave too soon!! :(

reviews.text: Since we had been coming to St. Pete for about 10 years, we had usually stayed at the more expensive resorts. Then we came across the bon-aire about 5 years ago. It was the traditional mom and pop place. It offers just as much as typical more expensive resorts. The landscaping is beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable and affordable. We had a party of 7 and we could get the ultra living apartments for only about $150 dollars a night. Unlike more expensive resorts, you are not nickel and dimed for everything. It is perfectly accessible to the beach and it offers volleyball courts, shuffleboard courts, and a traditional beach bar with AMAZING cheesburgers. There are 2 pools that are perfect for relaxing. It's in the midst of shops and good restaurants. Everyone we had talked to said that they had been coming to the bon-aire forever. It's a small comfortable place, with not a lot of people, so you do not feel over crowded. We have been coming here for about 5 years now, and we still plan to come in the future. We have even came twice during one summer. We recommend this place to anyone. It is for sure a family oriented vacation.
reviews.title: Love the Bon Aire Motel

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Bon Aire over 48 years now. It is a great family motel right on the beach. Maybe it's not the fanciest place, but it gets the job done. 2 very nice pools and the view is to die for. Great sunsets. We have gotten to know the same families that come down each year in July. It's a very nice place for familes to vacation. Sand Bar Bills is expensive but very good.
reviews.title: A Family Favorite

likes.disliked: — parking...only 1 space per room so cars not registered should be towed as signs suggest

aka: Bon Aire Hotel Saint Pete Beach
